hints.content:
To find how many heads the $\maroonD{\text{Second dragon}}$ has, we start with the number of heads the $\goldE{\text{First dragon}}$ has and subtract $\blueE{2}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8dec32b70df29e753fa83cd0d904a886d9e2cd99)

$\goldE{9} - \blueE{2} = \maroonD{\Box}$

Let's subtract to find how many heads the $\maroonD{\text{Second Dragon}}$ has.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ba5006984c38d2301e2c96289f24cac86609ea20)

$\goldE{9} - \blueE{2} = \maroonD{7}$

question.content:
Erin fought a dragon with $9$ heads.

Then she fought another dragon with $2$ fewer heads than the first dragon.

**How many heads did the second dragon have?**

  [[â˜ƒ input-number 1]]
